snippet: One of the most unusual events of the year was a chess game in Tripoli during the NATO bombing campaign between Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi and the president of the World Chess Federation.
abstract: Dylan Loeb McClain Chess column recounts several 2011 matches that mixed chess and politics.
lead_paragraph: One of the most unusual events of the year was a chess game in Tripoli during the NATO bombing campaign between Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi and the president of the World Chess Federation.

headline.main: Politics and Power Plays, Both on and Off the Board
headline.print_headline: Politics and Power Plays, Both On and Off the Board
